moves.1... d6 2. Nc3 Bg4 3. e3 a6: to prevent Bb5 so as to avoid any or all kind of pins that may develop later.
moves.4. d3 Nf6 5. Be2:
? 
i feel e4 would be better - pawns occupying the center and releasing the black bishop.
moves.6. Bd2 c6 7. Nd4 Bxe2 8. Qxe2 e6: to prevent Nf5 which threatens pawn on g7 and destroys king-side defense.
moves.11. g3 Nc6: i plan to place the knight on d4 - giving the queen a little trouble.
moves.13... Qd7 14. f4:
wasting a move to take a knight back just for a pawn exchange is a bad move here for 2 reasons:
1. it gives black (me) an extra move.
2.the pawn exchange brings the e3 bishop to f4 - thereby wasting the purpose for which the bishop was brought to e3
moves.18. Bxd4 cxd4 19. Nce2 O-O: first keep the king safe before you attack!!!
moves.20. Nxd4 Nxe4:
!!
if white captures Ne4, 21. .... Qxe4(check) - rook on h1 is lost.
moves.21. Qe3 Nf6:
!!
if white takes bishop on e7, 22. ..... Re8 - the white queen is lost.
moves.22. Kd2:
???????????????????????
a big big big mistake....u don't line queen and king on a black diagonal when the opponent has a supported black bishop!!!
moves.22... Nd5 23. Qf3:
????
removes support for Nd4 - it is lost.
